This is solely a single player game at the moment. Good luck finding a match that isnt locked. It's cool though, tower defence games are usually single player anyways. The carnival map though makes no sense to be dlc when it doesnt add anything but a single map, no guns or anything special, might as well bundle it with a increased xp modifier or something.
Played it some more hours, mainly in single player cause Carnival is such a good map but its dlc so nobody ever plays it online. Anyways not talking about the dlc here, the game itself is functional for a basic defence game. It's fun but all I am saying here is that we need some options for the modes besides difficulty. Such as +25% earned money or less explosive damage cause y'know, any bomber will smack your walls to the point the cheaper walls are better. Or the spitters do 1 attack and your sentry is dead. I mean they do like 150 dmg if you stand on their toxic spit, it's too much. So yeah, good enough game that we can expect no updates or balances because they're creating UZD 2

*This review is based on solo play*

A solid entry into the top-down, tower defense, zombie shooter genre. It's at a decent price-point, but it is map-lite so a sale price (usually around 35% off) may be preferable. 

The graphics are good, the controls pretty simple, and the upgrades to both base and character (of which there are several classes to choose from) keep it interesting and to be able to mold your characters and base to your preferred play style. I also appreciate that solo play is off-line; always appreciated!

I don't have too much to say about this in the negative sense other than the map-lite content. They're small-ish, and there aren't that many, so replay value declines as the maps become routine.

Take my review for what it's worth, because I'm normally not a huge Zombie-Shooter fan. BUT somehow I really like this little game (!)
Graphics are sharp and feel modern. Sounds are perfect with authentic weapon sound-effects, while bullets pierce anything they hit in a very realistic manner. And no stupid zombies constant 'vomiting' noises, like too many other zombie games!
The game here is not about running all over the place like a chicken-with-no-head while trying to shoot as many undead as you can. But rather to entrench yourself in the right spot and build you (very) temporary 'fortress' while trying to survive to as many waves as you can. 
In that sense, it really has a Tower Defense feel, and that's probably why I enjoy it so much!
The weapons and build items selection is generous and varied enough. Upgrades work as planned AND [spoiler] you even have boring music in the shopping mall elevator [/spoiler] lol!
So, c'mon folks: Let's fill-out those servers, and come help me shoot more of those darn bastard Bosses!! ;)

Just wanted to quickly post something after noticing a few negatives in reviews...You can't easily share cash, yet this serves a purpose. The medic class gains a lot more cash than other classes, but making it easy to share would ruin balance. The engineer gains a significant reduction on turret (etc) costs... if the medic (gathers money easily) could transfer cash, it would be game breaking.Lord Soupex is not impossible to defeat. You need to be careful... he splits into three when you 'kill' him, then these splits split again. The final versions are small and fast. You need to be careful - take out one 'split' version at a time, so you dont end up with a horde of small, fast version. Also, you can kite him around your turrets fairly easily.It seems difficult to begin with, but with a few hours practice you'll master it - and once you level up the classes, you can easily reach level 40 on certain levels with chokehold areas. Overall a very simply, basic game... mechanics are not clever, AI is not clever... but that's what makes it good. Easily one of the best wave survival type games, if you know what you're doing. If you're stick, lots of vids on youtube - none in english, but all you need is to watch how people setup defence, what guns to upgrade, etc.

Recommended to play with a friend or two, capable of getting of few hours of fun for a little ¬£¬£¬£.

A nice handful of interesting maps and a decent choice of options when it comes to building bases, with a nice selection of guns which can all be upgraded across multiple tiers. There's a large variety of enemies, basically similar to what you'd find in L4D and keeps you busy/moving as you improve after each defeat, coming to terms with your own strategies across the maps. Personally found the mall map on the second floor in the corner interesting, utilising the space, corners and corridors.

Although the game is a bit unbalanced, there's a boss every 10 rounds or so, and usually multiply, so by 30, you're facing 3 big bosses of which one splits into more and more when it gets downed, and the other just rinses through base builds so your defences become obsolete. By round 30, our weapons were maxed and there wasn't much else to improve, so your capability of continuing the game stagnates with the almost ridiculous overpowered enemies/bosses. Also small things like, you can buy an ammo box for 500 but sell it before it gets depleted for like 325?

But for the price, it's still worth it, and I'm interested in seeing what improvements and updates get released over time.

Ultimate Zombie Defense is fun. Can't say that about most games where it feels like a part-time job. Zombies come at you, because that is what zombies do. There are a few types from every zombie genre. The bosses are included at no extra charge.

Even for $5 there is a lot missing. Some of the things I have issue with are:

1. Bosses bugging
2. Multiple overpowered bosses spawning at once
3. Towers become useless because of constant suicide bombers.
4. Only weapon worth a damn is the auto shotgun and if you don't have a ammo crate down you will run out of ammo on the multiple boss waves,
5. Towers useless vs bosses at wave 40
6. No use for skill points after you cap
7. No way to upgrade traps.
8. Game becomes run in circles away from bosses and pray you don't have 2 soupex because you will be basically stun locked.
9. Constantly needing to interact with turrets to make them work again.
10. Walls are basically useless and are only good to aggro bosses on.

I could go on - but these are just a few of my issues.

Great cheap little co-op game! You should def pick this one up. It's a fun little tower defense style game. Wave after wave of zombies and creatures. The more you kill the more money you have between rounds for weapon upgrades and building a base to keep safe. My wife and I love it and have been playing for 3 days in a row now. Picked it up for $3...you can't beat it!

Game has solid bones, but needs more meat. 

Examples would be the ability to start at certain waves with a budget. More boss variety is going to be critical. (Side note- bosses need better balance. Souplex is absurd, especially in phases with 3 or more bosses.) Give the players 1-2 abilities as well. Think a potion slot (HP, Movement speed, invuln, damage increase) and a thrown item. Thrown item would be grenades, flares, molotovs, whatever. Lastly, the opening curve needs some work. I will say the first hour or two of the game felt very punishing, because you have to grind your class trait right away, and classes change dramatically once they get their key traits. I would say open with the unique trait unlocked and fill out the trees as your progression. Lastly, PLEASE give the ability to build mid-wave. Would go a very long way in the way an overall wave feels from start to finish.

Overall though, I'm really enjoying the game and looking forward to them iterating on the experience.

For this price this is a superb game, especially for playing with friends. It is already a good experience but could be even better with the following: 
-improvment on boss balancing 
-revamp medic/specialist skill tree to be on par with engineer/heavy
-a mechanism to stop random joiners selling all defense in open lobby
-a way for players to surpass the sentry/tower cap in later waves (50+ )
Fun as arcade game with a decent amount of longevity.  More fun the more there are playing.

It's good for a few hours, but I hope they make a sequel with consideration for the following:
- Leveling and skill tree upgrades should start at zero each game and occur after every wave
- Add active abilities to the skill tree, since it's current state contains only passive abilities and they're woefully under-powered.
- There should be active skills, especially some to combat the bosses other than "30% extra damage to bosses."  Imagine how much more fun it would be with Heavy Weapons calling orbital strikes, Medics injecting rage viruses into bosses to attack their fellow zombies/bosses, Specialists sniping a boss's eyes for 1000% damage to blind them for a time, and Engineers overpowering all turrets extra damage and fire rate.
- Add building upgrade research during a match, e.g. rate of fire, damage, range, special ability, etc. for all buildings of that type.  This is to help them be less obsolete after level 40.
- Co-op is more punishing than helpful, because you have to split a fixed budget with them.  For every person that joins your group, the amount of money and experience from each kill should increase a certain %, i.e. two people increases everything 25%, three people 60%, and four people 100%.
- Remove the placement limit on all buildings
Game is fun and addictive. Need more content at the moment but for 5$ its absolutely worth it.

Absolutely not.. The game starts out fun until you realize how ridiculously unbalanced Soupex (one of the bosses that spawns). Every 5-10 rounds one of these dudes spawns. Not only is he already OP; but its the only monster that has knockback. When you kill his form? Oh wait.. Nope he respawns into 3 mini versions of himself that teleport in a Triangle formation.. Meaning? Yeah they respawn inside your base. But wait.. It gets worse. Those 3 spawns once killed, spawn another 3 spawns each. ALL with KNOCKBACK so you physically cant do anything if you get caught in them.

Now sure; 1 of these is fine and you can typically recover from it though they'll destroy most of your base.. However past wave 40 (even on EASY) they decide "lets spawn multiple of them.. wave 50 having 4 and a berserker) making it literally impossible. ALL with KNOCKBACK so you physically cant do anything; it's an instant death.

Devs need some serious adjustments because the way it stand, there's no reason to continue playing past wave 40.

In a nutshell... waves, build, upgrade, repair, repeat.
Will be even better as they add maps and items.
Good game to play with 3 friend. There is only 3 map, but the replaybility come from the class.

The game is really fun and has a lot of replay potential to max out skills or find that strategy that gets you farther you have before. 

A couple cons tho, bullet phasing seems to be an issue, tho it has been addressed and noted for fixing in patch notes, 
Lord Supex (lord Suplex) can split between your walls and force you into a one sided fight. His smaller forms are impossible to run away from, even worse if you to run and gun. His hitboxes are crazy being able to hit in a diagonal attack half the bridge away it feels. His attacks knock you up/back but when there are multiple smalls of him they can perma CC you, which can instantly end a game at round 10. 

round 40 seems to be the wave to beat. Nearly 100 hours into the game now and 40 is my highest round on a map that isn't the mall (because you can manipulate zombie aggro pathing to form major kill zones. Almost to the point of never needing to fire a shot.) Weapons fall off super fast, fully upgraded auto shotgun falls off around wave 30 and deals minimal dmg to bosses, and thats every weapon, especially Sentry turrets and teslas...what good are max lvl Engineer turrets if they fall off way too early? 

The Heavy seems to be the worst class, almost as if it was rushed because they needed a 4th for diversity. Medic and Specialist share several skills the heavy has and the Beserk ability is borderline useless unless you activate it simply from letting acid spitters shoot at you. In a dire situation, you die before you get more than 10 shots off while below 20hp, especially on Hard/Expert when a suicide bomber zombie can completely destroy your fresh armor in one explosion. Medic has the advantage of gaining extra income from allies killing zombies and invulnerability for any ally at low hp, specialist gets massive boosts to special weapon dmg and increased money income, and the engineer gets a 20% discount on defenses and repairs also a drone that follows you that only does damage in the first couple waves. 

NEED MORE BASE DEFENSES, the laser fence was fun before the rollback and very very broken, but as mentioned earlier teslas and sentries fall off super fast, even with the 50% increased dmg from the engineer. so something that doesnt fall off super fast that also doesn't cost $50K. Bloaters and Suicide bombers deal extreme dmg to buildings almost to the point of one shotting the sandbags that have the most hp among base defenses. 
Something like a gun tower that doesnt need to be reset every couple minutes like sentries do. 

Other than that I highly recommend this game, and have bought this game for 3 people so we can play. It's fun, It has become my boredom just passing the time game. Super excited to see it as it developes.

I've had a lot of fun with this game.  The gist of it is this:
  - you get money by killing zombies and surviving waves
  - in between waves you purchase structures (such walls or defensive towers) and guns/gun upgrades

It's not a groundbreaking game concept, but this game implements it well. 

This game has one big drawback though.  The multiplayer is broken. Often times a multiplayer game will sorta freeze. You can run around, you can shoot things. But nothing dies and the sprites get stuck in endless move animations (without going anywhere). At this point, you cannot progress and the game is pretty much over. 

This is a huge letdown especially after getting to the stronger waves.

If the devs don't fix the multiplayer, I'll probably change this review to a negative review.

This game is simply epic, whilst it is somewhat small it has so much to offer and allot of potential.

Long have i been bored of games being released which don't even work, aren't even ready, and aren't even challenging. 

Its a sad state that games now have to be made easy, because players are to thick or to lazy to work things out - Classic example Diablo 3 which cost millions to make yet you can walk the game and not even die once, what a load of s hite the industry is in now. 

This game is challenging at first, but very fun, once you get the hang of it its really enjoyable to see how far you can get and work with other players to help you. You can play over and over and no get bored, the game play is spot on. 

Be warned however if your a Noob, who wants to have it all handed to you without any effort because your brain cant work out simple problems or to retarded to work in a team maybe go play Fortnight or Diablo 3 ect....

Bullet-points:

Graphics:
They're alright. Its nothing to give an award for, but it isn't ugly.

Story:
A few lines of text.

Gameplay:
Really fun. I played with 2 of my friends and we had a blast for about 3 hours.
Really, You should get this game. Its amazing for the price right now.

Audience:
If you're above 9 years old, you'll be more than fine.

Spec Requirements:
I have an i7 intel core and a 660TI and can run it on "Ultra" graphics and 60 frames.
If you have a broken floor tile you can run  this game.

Negatives:
- AI can be really stupid sometimes.

 You'll be based up (No doors so you cant leave your walls,) and there will be one more zombie left. Sadly, hes across the map, one of the slow ones, and hitting a wall you forgot to sell from the ruins of your old base.

- I've seen this in other reviews, the hit-boxes in this game are very strange. Sometimes they just phase through the zombies.

- You can essentially become immortal on the mall map.

Final notes:
- This game is 4 dollars. (As of writing) Regardless of bugs, you will almost 100% get your money's worth out of this game.
Its a solid game. Get some friends, have a blast. Seriously. Just buy it already.

Ultimate Zombie Defense is an isometric base building/TDesque game. 

Graphics are acceptable, though map details are often lacking (the mall in particular).  Documentation is limited, but the majority of buildings/powers have sufficient mouse-overs to make the game enjoyable without any meaningful experience.

Hit boxes/accuracy are highly questionable -- both for dealing damage to enemies and for enemies striking your character.

Character movement is viable, but seems somewhat "clunky" -- specifically when sprinting in a forward facing direction there seems to be some delay in the change to your speed.

Online play seems to be limited to friends, where in public (non-passworded games) seem to result in hosts automatically kicking anyone who joins (if one wanted a private game why not use the password feature??). As such, the quality of the community remains questionable as of this review.

The game, overall, is enjoyable and the price is reasonable -- especially when on sale.
Best played with friends but the solo experience is still worth a buy.

First impressions. It's a fun top down shooter. Upgrade and defense building elements make it more robust. The co-op system works well. The graphics are detailed and runs well on my wife's robust PC as well as my older tower. The audio quality is good, especially the weapon sound effects. As the development of the game continues (as we hope it will) we would love to see automatic level progression (moving to different areas of the city for example). As it stands now, by being static and just attempting how many levels you can survive it comes across as more of an arcade shooter which gets tiresome after playing it several times.

Wicked game!, before I write pros & cons I just wanna say..  I've noticed few reviews saying you get your health back at the end of the wave but not your ammo? well.. you can get your ammo stock by buying  a ammo crate!

Pros: Great Top Down Zombie Shooter! selection of guns and equipment to pick from, lots of different zombies coming at you the more you progress in the waves.. you can get lost in the game.

Con: Not much to complain about fair enough it is still early and we only get 1 stage and its only offline at the moment so i cant make it past wave 14.. but apart from that I dont really have anything to complain about.

CANT WAIT FOR THE FULL VERSION!

As of now, this game is simple survival waves with a defense building mechanic (walls, traps and turrets).  It's well-done, and has a nice arcade feel that's great for short bursts.  I think the game is actually underpriced, given its competence.

Fun game but needs multiplayer. Also needs a way to increase your damage output via skills or talents or something. You can't have flat damage and the enemy continue to increase in toughness and number. It becomes a battle of diminishing returns and sucks the fun out of it.

I've had a lot of fun so far and would definitely recommend it. Really good music to match and killing zombies is always fun. 
With that said I've found that trying to build a base, and building in general really, is not nearly as effective as kiting. Turrets are a bit unreliable in that they will run out of ammo, which requires you to run back and interact with them before your structures get destroyed; turrets also seem to disappear after a time even without being damaged. I can see why they've done things this way but in my opinion it could use a bit of tweaking, especially when playing solo.
The tongue zombies seem to have unlimited range when they shoot it at you making it impossible to dodge, from what I've experienced so far. 
Overall it's totally worth the few dollars and I can't wait till they add more content.
